passage_text: Not only is the cost of a wedding soaring — couples spent an average of $30,000 in 2013, according to TheKnot.com, up from $28,000 the year before and the highest level since 2008 — but wedding guests are spending more than ever, as well.

With the average UK wedding hosting 96 guests, this is a total gift value of £4,896 1 per wedding, which could amount to a £1.2billion wedding gift bill for UK guests over the course of a year. That's an increase of around £129m since 2011 2.

Couples spent an average $220 per guest at weddings in 2013, according to TheKnot.com, including $66 on food alone. But all of our experts agreed that basing the cost of your gift on how much you think the couple is spending on food and entertainment is an antiquated notion.

The average wedding cost in the United States is $26,444. Couples typically spend between $19,833 and $33,055 but, most couples spend less than $10,000. This does not include cost for a honeymoon. Understanding wedding cost now can help you with your wedding budget later.

According to the American Express survey, the average wedding gift is $144 for a family member and $97 for a close friend. More affluent wedding guests give an average wedding gift worth $251 for any wedding they attend, while co-workers come in at the low end of the scale at an average of $66. Not surprisingly, the more removed a wedding guest is from the bride and groom, the smaller their wedding gift tends to be.

The average wedding gift for a family member is around $150 per person – so something in the order of $200 – $400 for the both of you would be reasonable – depending on the venue and style of the wedding.
